definition: to grab/to catch/to arrest/to snatch/to scratch
to walk/to go/to run/to move (of vehicle)/to visit/to leave/to go away/to die (euph.)/from/through/away (in compound verbs, such as 撤走[che4 zou3])/to change (shape, form, meaning)

sentences.english: Buckle up, it may harder for aliens to suck you out of your car.
sentences.chinese: 繫好安全帶，這樣外形人也更難把你從車子裏抓走。

sentences.english: A big bear hugged one and then there were two.
sentences.chinese: 一隻大熊抓走一個還剩兩個。

sentences.english: Then, he put Pinocchio on the ground and took Geppetto away.
sentences.chinese: 接着，他就把皮諾奇放在地上，把格培多抓走了。

sentences.english: Tom’s neighbour was snatched by the FBI.
sentences.chinese: 湯姆的鄰居被聯邦調查局抓走了。

sentences.english: I told you we should have got him yesterday.
sentences.chinese: 我告訴你們我們昨天就應該把他抓走。

sentences.english: They swooped down on a night club and made 5 arrests.
sentences.chinese: 他們突然襲擊了一家夜總會，抓走了五個人。

sentences.english: Cutter the flying officer showed up and captured Barla and brought her back to the colony.
sentences.chinese: 到了晚上，來了個飛螞蟻軍官把八拉抓走帶回蟻國了。

sentences.english: He gave her a surreptitious look as he took four more of her cookies.
sentences.chinese: 他又把她的餅乾抓走四塊，還偷偷向她瞄了一眼。

sentences.english: He was yanked off by some men this morning.
sentences.chinese: 他是今天早晨被幾個男人抓走的。

sentences.english: The next day, two men in plain clothes arrived to pick up Helmut.
sentences.chinese: 第二天，兩個身着便衣的人來吧海姆特抓走了。

sentences.english: Say nothing, and all for man of the house to the captured.
sentences.chinese: 甭提了，全讓男主人給抓走了。

sentences.english: Jiang Yunyang was arrested, dumb sister fainted in the room.
sentences.chinese: 姜雲陽被抓走了，啞妹暈倒在屋子裏。

sentences.english: Which knowledge gets married only three day , Fan Xi have been captured very right away.
sentences.chinese: 哪知成婚才三天，範喜良就被抓走了。

sentences.english: Shortly after their marriage, Laszlo was apprehended by Gestapo[4].
sentences.chinese: 但婚後不久，拉茲洛就被蓋世太保抓走了。

sentences.english: I remember that the little boy grabbed Sharon’s ball.
sentences.chinese: 我還記得那個小男孩抓走了莎倫的皮球。

definition: to run off rebuffed/to fend off/(to fight off and make sb) run off
to kill/to cause death/to do sb to death
to catch/to grapple with/to hold onto
to kill sb to prevent them from divulging a secret/to silence sb
to rescue/to help out of difficulties/to save the situation
to impersonate/to act the part of sb/to disguise oneself as sb else
